Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
CAN: The student can identify and draw basic elements of some habitats, likely one land habitat such as a playground with trees or bushes.
The student can draw and label a few living things like trees and maybe one or two animals such as a squirrel or an ant in one habitat.
The student may attempt to draw a water habitat, like a pond, but details might be sparse or incomplete.
CANNOT: The student is likely unable to accurately compare and contrast the types of living things between two habitats consistently (misunderstands which animals belong in which habitat).
The student may not label all elements correctly or may leave out key components like labeling water-specific plants or animals (e.g., fish or clams).
Patterns of plant and animal diversity across habitats are not clearly identified or marked (student may depict animals at random without understanding diversity patterns).
